Intraepithelial Lymphocytosis: Intraepithelial lymphocytes; small, round; dense nuclei; disrupts architecture; associated with neoplastic epithelium; stromal lymphoplasmacytic infiltration.
Stromal Lymphoplasmacytic Infiltration: Lymphocytes in stroma; plasma cells present; small cells with large nuclei; abundant basophilic cytoplasm; interspersed infiltration; reactive changes; possible fibrosis or edema.
Neoplastic Epithelium: Neoplastic epithelium; dysplasia; increased nuclear size; hyperchromasia; prominent nucleoli; high nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio; loss of differentiation; irregular glands or sheets.
Invasion into the Submucosa: Invasion into submucosa; scattered cells to clusters; neoplastic cells breach muscularis mucosae; lymphocytic response around cancer cells.
Low Rate of Lymph Node Metastasis: Low lymph node metastasis; regional lymph nodes with few or no cancer cells; disrupted lymph node architecture; pattern of replacement or expansion.
Poor Differentiation: Poorly differentiated adenocarcinomas; lacks specialized features; aggressive tumor; unformed glandular structures; infiltrating lymphoid stroma.
Lymphoid Stroma: Lymphoid stroma infiltration; “lace-like” pattern; irregular tubules and cords; immune component in microenvironment; variable lymphoid infiltration.
EBER-ISH Staining: EBER-ISH positive; detects EBV RNA; diagnostic criteria; visualizes virus genetic material; differentiates EBV-positive cancer.
Epithelial Markers: Epithelial markers positive; CK7 expression reduced; confirms epithelial origin; differentiates EBVaGC from EBV-negative cancers.
Lace-like Pattern: Lace-like pattern; irregularly anastomosing tubules and cords; complex interconnected network; irregular net-like structure.
DNA Methylation: Hypermethylated profile; loss of normal architecture; cellular atypia; uncontrolled proliferation; higher cell density; disorganized growth; loss of differentiation; primitive cell appearance; condensed or irregular nuclei.
High frequency of PIK3CA mutations: High mitotic rates; atypical gland formation; cellular pleomorphism; increased angiogenesis; altered tumor borders; stromal fibrosis or desmoplastic reaction.
Rare TP53 mutations: Regular tissue morphology; lower cellular atypia; lower mitotic rates; potential senescence markers; normal apoptotic rates.
Syncytial trabecular pattern: Syncytial trabecular pattern; nested growth; cord-like structures; indistinct cell borders; interconnected net-like structure.
Lymphoepithelioma-like Histology: EBV-positive; lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma; large sheets; syncytial clusters; undifferentiated cells; prominent lymphoid infiltration; no glandular formation; non-keratinizing; vesicular nuclei; prominent nucleoli; desmoplastic reaction.
Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocytes: Tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes; dispersed or clustered; infiltrating between cells or stromal; indicative of immune response.
High frequency of ARID1A mutations: Prominent intra-tumoral lymphocytes; loss of ARID1A staining; detected by IHC; variable tumor morphology; associated with cellular pleomorphism, high mitotic activity, aggressive growth pattern.
9p24.1 amplifications: 9p24.1 amplification; PD-L1 and PD-L2 overexpression; increased TILs; non-keratinizing morphology; Reed-Sternberg cells in lymphoma; potential response to checkpoint blockade.
Ulcered or saucer-like tumor: Central necrosis; ulceration with epithelial loss; robust inflammatory infiltrate; reactive cellular changes; marginal roll at ulcer edges; increased vascularity; surrounding fibrosis.
Marked thickening gastric wall: Fibrosis in submucosa; inflammatory cell infiltration; muscular hypertrophy; edema; neoplastic infiltration in linitis plastica; glandular atrophy; intestinal metaplasia; granulomatous inflammation; vascular congestion; mucosal hyperplasia.
DNA CpG hypermethylation: Increased proliferation; high mitotic index; infiltrative tumor borders; cellular atypia; nuclear irregularity; loss of p16^INK4a expression on IHC.
EBV-encoded miRNAs: Lymphoepithelioma-like features; dense lymphoid infiltrates; variable tumor cell differentiation; prominent inflammation; EBER-positive staining on in situ hybridization.
Increased TIL Infiltration: Densely packed stromal lymphocytes; high nucleus-to-cytoplasm ratio; lymphocyte aggregates; tertiary lymphoid structures; sign of immune response.
Higher Levels of CD4, CD8 T Cells and T: CD4+ in periphery; CD4 stain highlighted; CD8+ within tumor; CD8 stain highlighted; Tregs by FOXP3 stain; suppress immune response.
High levels of T cell activation: High T cell activation; lymphoid aggregates; larger T cells; abundant cytoplasm; prominent nucleoli; CD69, HLA-DR, OX40, ICOS, Ki-67 expression.
Higher Levels of Immune Checkpoint Marke: PD-1 on T cells; PD-L1 on tumor/immune cells; CTLA-4 in lymphoid aggregates/invasive margins; LAG-3 on T cells; TIM-3 on T/innate immune cells.
Higher expression of anti-tumor immunity: Increased membrane staining; immune cell marker staining; dense immune stromal infiltration; organized lymphoid structures; associated inflammatory reaction.
